nl.inl.util

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.util.StringUtil

  • public class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Een collectie reguliere expressies om verschillende patronen uit Strings te filteren.

      • abbreviate

        public static java.lang.String abbreviate(java.lang.String str,
                          int preferredLength)
        Abbreviates a string for display if necessary. Also replaces line breaks with spaces. Uses overshootAllowed of 0, and adds ellipsis if abbreviated.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to abbreviate
        preferredLength - the maximum length we would like to see
        Returns:
        the (possibly) abbreviated string

      • abbreviate

        public static java.lang.String abbreviate(java.lang.String str,
                          int preferredLength,
                          int overshootAllowed,
                          boolean addEllipsis)
        Abbreviates a string for display if necessary. Also normalizes whitspace (replacing a line break with a space).
        Parameters:
        str - the string to abbreviate
        preferredLength - the maximum length we would like to see
        overshootAllowed - how many more characters than the previous value is allowable
        addEllipsis - whether or not we should add "..." at the end if we abbreviated
        Returns:
        the (possibly) abbreviated string

      • escapeCapitals

        public static java.lang.String escapeCapitals(java.lang.String str,
                              java.lang.String escapeString)
        Escape capital letters with the specified escape string. NOTE: this only works properly on ASCII strings! This can be used to compensate for case-insensitive filesystems.
        Parameters:
        str - the string in which to escape capitals
        escapeString - the string to add in front of each capital
        Returns:
        the escaped string

      • limitStringToLength

        public static java.lang.String limitStringToLength(java.lang.String str,
                                   int preferredLength,
                                   int overshootAllowed,
                                   boolean addEllipsis)
        Limit a string to a certain length, adding an ellipsis if desired. Tries to cut the string at a word boundary, but will cut through words if necessary.
        Parameters:
        str - the string
        preferredLength - the preferred maximum length for the result string
        overshootAllowed - the number of characters the string may run beyond the preferred length without resorting to cutting
        addEllipsis - whether or not to add three periods (...) to a string after cutting
        Returns:
        the resulting string. This is at most preferredLength + max(overshootAllowed, 3) long (if addEllipsis is true).

      • pluralize

        public static java.lang.String pluralize(java.lang.String singular,
                         long number)
        Optionally 'pluralize' a singular noun by appending an s if the number is not equal to 1. Obviously, this doesn't take irregular plural forms (sheep/sheep, man/men) into account.
        Parameters:
        singular - the singular to 'pluralize'
        number - if this equals 1, no s is added
        Returns:
        the possibly pluralized form

      • capitalizeFirst

        public static java.lang.String capitalizeFirst(java.lang.String str)
        Convert the first character in a string to uppercase.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to be capitalized
        Returns:
        the capitalized string

      • getPerWordCollator

        public static java.text.RuleBasedCollator getPerWordCollator(java.text.Collator base)
        Returns a new collator that takes spaces into account (unlike the default Java collators, which ignore spaces), so we can sort "per word". Example: with the default collator, "cat dog" would be sorted after "catapult" (a after d). With the per-word collator, "cat dog" would be sorted before "catapult" (cat before catapult). NOTE: the base collator must be a RuleBasedCollator, but the argument has type Collator for convenience (not having to explicitly cast when calling)
        Parameters:
        base - the collator to base the per-word collator on.
        Returns:
        the per-word collator

      • escapeDoubleQuotedString

        public static java.lang.String escapeDoubleQuotedString(java.lang.String str)
        Escape double quote and backslash with a backslash character. Useful for putting strings between double quotes.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to escape
        Returns:
        the escaped string
